properties.name: 90s Wrecking Krew Spiritual Home
properties.description: Posted by MoflowMuch sessioned 90s mtb trail destination including an MBUK teen thriller from 1993 - tongue out bunnyhops keepinitfresh! Now mostly deforested and the founding brethren fragmented but discovered some excellent new stuff on the back side from Pwll Du. Steep and loamy, drains well with a great vantage over Meifod and the Tanat Valley. Links with good lanes and pubs for a summer freeride!

properties.name: Adventure Bolthole
properties.description: Posted by Moflow

properties.name: Alehouse of middle earth
properties.description: Posted by Moflow

properties.name: Arboreal Paradise
properties.description: Posted by MoflowImported Californian Redwoods plantation and other species with the fallen - but ever growing - tree and the most ostentatious Beckingham Palace Chicken Coop you ever did see! Also, historic home to some of the most sublime, steep loamy trails in the UK ending in a sweeping natural half pipe! MTs legally no go beacuse of private landowner but keep your ears pricked for the quad bike and go explore! Worth a picnic ramble with a special friend whatever... Especially if you can find the Scandinavian hide with a combi lock!

properties.name: Cadair Idris
properties.description: Posted by Moflow UK Mini Avalanche classic: snaking shale fire road, rock studded moorland singletrack, pounding scree and double double diamond rocky horror staircase to the summit. Sculpted glacial lakes and valleys running to the Irish Sea and inland from this the geographical, and once spiritual epi centre of Wales. Lock in the game face and pin it back to the farm in 21mins - now go and kill it on the Sarennes.

properties.name: Carn Fadryn
properties.description: Posted by Moflow A neolithic freeride roller coaster with far reaching views of the Lleyn, Cardigan Bay and the Irish Sea. Black diamond rock gardens, chisel cut boulders & sweeping corners on polished grass witnessed only by the jackdaws. Siaradwch gymraeg ar y Llyn, cornel falchdar cymry.

properties.name: Climach Trails
properties.description: Posted by Moflow Classic forestry trail, originally heralded the start of the smoother flowier welsh build but since eroded by elemental usage & the elements and eroded to a gilt edged rock dance. Death grip the whooping final descent for maximum satisfaction! Check out Centre for Alternative Technology - fast becoming Centre for Necessary Technology which has a cafe and runs dicount for arrival by two wheels.

properties.name: Deep Creek Ledge Trail
properties.description: Posted by Moflow

properties.name: Fools Falls
properties.description: Posted by Moflow

properties.name: Freeride Trails
properties.description: Posted by MoflowClassic borders hill scramble with some of the most technical freeride lines around. A lot of untapped shaping potential with a range of gradients, tree types, rocky outcrops. Go dig!

properties.name: Lampkin's Shimmy
properties.description: Posted by Moflow

properties.name: Landrover Grounding - memorable Mayday
properties.description: Posted by Moflow

properties.name: MTB Freeride
properties.description: Posted by MoflowHillside and forest a playground of trails - most of the home built stuff now overgrown but the main line off the Trig Point down the meadow is a blast of off piste lips and lines. Recall some huge dumps of snow back in the 90s too. Big up to Mrs Wilkins at the foot of the hillside who used to keep us in tea and cake and humour our excitable banter!

properties.name: Mountain bike / hike beacon
properties.description: Posted by Moflow 400m or so above the Severn Valley. Sweeping 360 views out to the Cambrian mountains, Berwyns and Shropshire plains - and as distant as the Runcorn petrochem plants on a clear day. Great technical trails running in most directions - especially the boulder strewn sheep track off the backside, just watch out for hikers on the forestry singletracks lower down. Link in with Moel y Golfa and Middletown Hill (see tags) for a 1000m borders freeride classic. Work it fatboy!

properties.name: Ochre sandclay exploration - guided by a v. fast vetetiste
properties.description: Posted by Moflow

properties.name: Rabbit Run DH - this is Atherton country!
properties.description: Posted by Moflow

properties.name: Ranger Path - the zig zags
properties.description: Posted by Moflow

properties.name: Roman Funpark
properties.description: Posted by MoflowMiddletwon Hill, bald grassy borderlands ridge rising to the terraced remains of one of Caesar\'s camps. Great spot for some mach 1 45mph+ descending, snowboarding or mountain boarding (take your chances on the last one!) due to relatively smooth surface. Links nicely with Moel y Golfa and Rodney\'s Pillar.

properties.name: Thinker's Freeride
properties.description: Posted by MoflowTranquil deciduous walking woodland with some installed sculpture pieces - be sensitive to such serenity as you tail whip off the rollers, rail the bracken and pin the steps!
